actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to help relieve the burden of high property taxes by allowing each homeowner a Federal tax credit or rebate for property taxes paid for the support of public schools.

summary.text: Residential Property Tax Relief Act - Allows homeowners a Federal tax credit under the Internal Revenue Code for up to $150 of property taxes paid for the support of public schools. Provides that a person over age 62 who has paid more than 5 percent of his total income in property taxes shall not be limited to the amount of income tax payable for the taxable year in determining the amount of such credit.

titles.title: A bill to help relieve the burden of high property taxes by allowing each homeowner a Federal tax credit or rebate for property taxes paid for the support of public schools.
